com.analog.lyric.collect

Class BinaryHeap<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • com.analog.lyric.collect.AbstractHeap<E>
        • com.analog.lyric.collect.BinaryHeap<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IHeap<E>, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>

    public class BinaryHeap<E>
extends AbstractHeap<E>
    Array-based binary heap implementation of IHeap.

    Insertion, removal from head of the queue, and changing priority is O(log(size())). Bulk insertion and priority changes with deferred reordering is O(n + size()).

    Since:
    0.0.5

        public boolean changePriority(IHeap.IEntry<E> oldEntry,
                     double priority)
        Description copied from interface: IHeap
        Change priority of given entry in queue.

        When changing more than half of the priorities in bulk, it may be more efficient to defer reordering.

        Returns:
        false if entry was not in the queue.
        See Also:
        IHeap.deferOrdering(boolean)

      • deferOrdering

        public final boolean deferOrdering()
        Description copied from interface: IHeap
        If true, then operations that might affect the order of the queue will not cause it to be reordered until required by some operation such as IHeap.peek() or IHeap.poll(), after which this attribute will automatically be set to false.

        Implementations are not required to implement deferral.

        Specified by:
        deferOrdering in interface IHeap<E>
        Overrides:
        deferOrdering in class AbstractHeap<E>
        See Also:
        IHeap.deferOrdering(boolean), IHeap.isOrdered()

      • deferOrdering

        public boolean deferOrdering(boolean defer)
        Description copied from interface: IHeap
        Defers or undefers ordering of queue.

        When set to true and the implementation supports it, reordering of the queue will be deferred until the invocation of the first method that requires it, namely one of the peek or poll methods or this method with defer set to false. When supported, this will lead to faster amortized reordering when making bulk changes affecting the majority of the entries in the queue.

        When set to false, the queue will immediately be ordered.

        Specified by:
        deferOrdering in interface IHeap<E>
        Overrides:
        deferOrdering in class AbstractHeap<E>
        Returns:
        true if value of attribute was set to specified value. Will always return false if defer is true and implementation does not support deferral.
        See Also:
        IHeap.deferOrderingForBulkAdd(int), IHeap.deferOrderingForBulkChange(int)

      • deferOrderingForBulkAdd

        public boolean deferOrderingForBulkAdd(int n)
        Description copied from interface: IHeap
        Defer ordering given n entries to be added to the queue.

        Invokes IHeap.deferOrdering(boolean) if n is large enough to expect an amortized performance benefit.

        Specified by:
        deferOrderingForBulkAdd in interface IHeap<E>
        Overrides:
        deferOrderingForBulkAdd in class AbstractHeap<E>
        Parameters:
        n - is the number of entries the caller intends to add to the queue.
        Returns:
        true if IHeap.deferOrdering() was enabled.

      • deferOrderingForBulkChange

        public boolean deferOrderingForBulkChange(int n)
        Description copied from interface: IHeap
        Defer ordering given n entries to change their priorities.

        Invokes IHeap.deferOrdering(boolean) if n is large enough to expect an amortized performance benefit.

        Specified by:
        deferOrderingForBulkChange in interface IHeap<E>
        Overrides:
        deferOrderingForBulkChange in class AbstractHeap<E>
        Parameters:
        n - is the number of entries the caller intends to invoke IHeap.changePriority(IEntry, double) on.
        Returns:
        true if IHeap.deferOrdering() was enabled.

      • ensureCapacity

        public void ensureCapacity(int capacity)
        Description copied from interface: IHeap
        Ensure that queue has sufficient capacity for the specified number of elements.

        For some implementations, calling this before adding many elements can avoid the cost of incrementally growing the capacity as elements are added.

        Specified by:
        ensureCapacity in interface IHeap<E>
        Overrides:

      • merge

        public boolean merge(IHeap<E> other)
        Description copied from interface: IHeap
        Destructively merges contents of other heap into this one.

        Removes all elements from other and adds them to this heap. Underlying entries will only be transferred if class of other is compatible with this class (typically meaning it is the same class).

        Specified by:
        merge in interface IHeap<E>
        Overrides:
        merge in class AbstractHeap<E>
        Returns:
        true if entry objects were transferred.

      • offer

        public BinaryHeap.Entry<E> offer(E element,
                        double priority)
        Description copied from interface: IHeap
        Adds instance of element to the queue with given priority and returns the entry created for it, which may be used to relatively efficiently remove it or change its priority. Unless the implementation does not support it, the same element may be added multiple times with different priorities.
